From the standpoint of an American watching an Indian movie:

I was impressed with the cinematography, the scope of the editing, the music & the smooth transition of intensity to story-line.

Friends say this is simply a remake of Ramayana conceptually. I, unfortunately have nothing to make that comparison. To me it's all new.
The women are beautiful, the activity is fast, it's relatively captivating. I enjoyed it.

But then I am comparing it to Hollywood, which has lost most of it's magic & produces 2 or 3 good flicks a year at best. And MOST of THAT is re-makes of truly great concepts. There is little new & original; so I am not expecting wondrous films on a continuum from ANYONE.
To me, it was worth watching.
